topics.body:
Speaking of sleep how do you folks deal with sleep problems?



I have to go back to college in a week and two days and it's really hard for me to get on a regular schedule.  The reason why is that even though I don't dream much my dreams scare me cause of how realistic they are.  Even if I'm totally aware it's a dream and try to lucid dream it won't work at all.  When I dream I can touch, smell, taste, feel sensation of things as if it were real life and even when I know it's a dream it doesn't effect the dream.  Even in the dreams if you tried to jump in front of a car to jolt yourself awake you're going to feel that and while still in the dream go to the hospital and everything.

You can understand why I have this problem falling asleep.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5361c825636872417c710000#post_5361c825636872417c710000
I've never had problems sleeping.
But then again I'm 23 years old and still cuddle with my plushy collecton.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5361c825636872417c710000#post_5361c825636872417c710000
Try hypnosis, it might allow you to have better dreams since you are "talking" to your subconscious, also it may help you get to sleep faster as well.
